button toggle all accordions
How do we assess your application?

For Commercialisation Guidance an AusIndustry Customer Service Manager will review your EOI and give you feedback. Feedback can be face-to-face, over the phone or by other means fitting the situation. You may then be assigned a Commercialisation Adviser or referred to other government assistance programs.

For an Accelerating Commercialisation Grant, your application will go through a competitive merit process. We will prepare a report on all eligible applications prior to merit assessment which includes a due diligence report, completed by a Commercialisation Adviser. This report examines the claims you have made against the merit criteria. The Programme Delegate will make the final decision.

What are the merit criteria?

We will first assess your grant application against the ‘need for funding’ criterion. If you don’t meet this criterion, your application will not proceed.

If you are a Commercialisation Office or Eligible Partner Entity, you don’t need to satisfy the ‘need for funding’ criterion.

If you satisfy the ‘need for funding’ criterion, we will assess your application against the following criteria:

  • Market Opportunity
  • Value Proposition
  • Execution Plan
  • Management Capability
  • National Benefits

The Customer Information Guide has more information about the merit criteria and how to meet them.

What happens next?

For Commercialisation Guidance, an adviser may ask for further information to support your EOI. How we give guidance is appropriate to the situation. It can be face-to-face, over the phone or by email.

You will get advice on your commercialisation project to work out if applying for an Accelerating Commercialisation Grant is for you.

For an Accelerating Commercialisation Grant, you will receive a written offer if your application is successful.

From there, you will enter into a funding agreement with us. The funding agreement contains a schedule for payments and progress reporting. A sample funding agreement is available to view.

If your application is unsuccessful, we will notify you in writing. You will be able to discuss the outcome with a Commercialisation Adviser.
